Display colors in a grid using ggplot2

show_colors.Rd

show_colors() creates a simple color swatch grid with optional hex labels and optional title.

Usage

show_colors(
  colours,
  labels = TRUE,
  label_size = 5,
  label_color = "white",
  ncol = NULL,
  nrow = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  title_size = 14,
  title_color = "black"
)

Arguments

colours

Character vector of hex colors to display.

labels

Logical, whether to show color codes as text labels. Default TRUE.

label_size

Numeric, size of the label text.

label_color

Color for the label text (default "white").

ncol

Number of columns in the grid. If NULL will be calculated automatically.

nrow

Number of rows in the grid. If NULL will be calculated automatically.

title

Optional plot title text.

title_size

Numeric, size of the title text.

title_color

Color of the title text.

Value

A ggplot object showing the color swatches.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
show_colors(c("#0570c2", "#F9B908", "#ad8bb8", "#009382"), title = "My Palette")
} # }
